lines.text: Oh, Dad, this is getting monotonous! Every year we do the same thing. We go to Saratoga, we go to Newport, then we come to Glencove for the yacht races.
[instead of watching the yacht races, Bruce turns his binoculars on Betty]

Bruce, you know this trip to Africa in search of the lost City of the Dead will be the most thrilling experience of our lives. Why, man, we're going to see things nobody has laid eyes on... at least not for centuries!
Maybe, Andy, but I'm from Missouri - you'll have to show me.
A moment ago you didn't want us. Thinking about those long, lonesome jungle nights?
They do say the nights are gorgeous, gorgeous.
[Bruce flips a coin to determine if the Grahams will join his expedition]
Bah! Heads we go... perhaps it's heads we lose.
Kobis - headhunters! They're headin' back in the direction from which we came!
Maybe they owe a friendly visit to the Posa tribe.
If they're headin' for the Posa tribe, they're going to stock up on provisions for the winter.
The serum... did you get it?
It's nice being your guinea pig.
